sorcer.service

Interface Executor


  • public interface Executor
    An top-level common local interface for all service-to-service (S2S) providers in SORCER. Each service accepts a service-oriented mogram Mogram to be processed locally as the follow up of Exerter#exert(Mogram, Transaction) and returns the mogram after executing it locally.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Mogram execute(Mogram mogram, Transaction txn)
      A generic service request as specified by an exertion - a generic service message.
      boolean isAuthorized(javax.security.auth.Subject subject, Signature signature)
      Returns true if the subject is authorized to execute the exertion.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        Mogram execute(Mogram mogram,
               Transaction txn)
        throws TransactionException,
               ExertionException,
               java.rmi.RemoteException
        A generic service request as specified by an exertion - a generic service message. It can be carried out dynamically and indirectly by any Service peer and directly by a Service matching the exertion's method Signature.
        Parameters:
        mogram - an input mogram
        txn - The transaction (if any) under which to provide service.
        Returns:
        a resulting exertion
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if a transaction error occurs
        ExertionException - if an exertion invocation failed for any reason
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • isAuthorized

        boolean isAuthorized(javax.security.auth.Subject subject,
                     Signature signature)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns true if the subject is authorized to execute the exertion.
        Parameters:
        subject - subject invoking the exertion
        signature - a signature
        Returns:
        true if authorized, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
